text: Henjunaha Lairoulembi (), or simply known as Henjunaha, is a folk tale in the ancient Moirang Kangleirol legends of Meitei mythology and folklore. It is the love story of Henjunaha and his lady love Lairoulembi, who are the true lovers in the second rebirth of divine lovers in the epic of Ancient Moirang. == In later versions == * The story was notably rewritten during the times of Maharaja Bhagyachandra, a King of Medieval Manipur. * In 2010, Henjunaha, a drama, was written by K. B. Sharma, based on the story of the hero. * In 2012, a book Henjunaha Lairoulembi, was published in the Manipur Hindi Parishad, Imphal. It's based on the saga of the hero Henjunaha and his lady love Lairoulembi. * In 2017, a folk play named "Henjunaha" premiered, based on the saga of the legendary hero. ==References== == Other websites == * Henjunaha hosted at E-Pao Category:Meitei folklore
title: Henjunaha
